summary: flaviviridae viruses are single-stranded, positive-sense RNA viruses. codon usage bias in 65 flaviviridae viruses is low with the average value of GC contents being 50.5%. the lowest value is 40.2%. synonymous codon usage bias exists in a wide range of species from prokaryotes to eukaryotes. comppositional constraints and natural selection are thought to be two main factors influencing codon usage variation among the gene in different organisms. powassan virus, yellow fever virus, and spondweni virus are mediated by ticks. 671% rise in cases in the last 18 years, which has become an emerging danger worldwide. spondweni virus can cause a self-limiting febrile illness characterized by headache, myalgia, nausea, and arthralgia. 0.429 0.075 0.713 Bagaza virus NC_012534.1 54.46 0.429 54.89 0.415 0.487 0.4303 -0.801 0.086 0.717 west Nile virus 1 NC_009942.1 56.15 0.438 0.522 0.5509 -0.973 0.061 0.714. the codons AUG and UGG are the codons. effective number of codons (ENC) analysis was used to quantify the extent of the codon usage bias of viruses coding sequences. the ENC values range from 20 to 61, in which the larger it is, the weaker the codon preference is. the corresponding amino acids are coded by all synonymous codons equally. the values of GC12 and GC3 of Flaviviridae virus were calculated by the EMBOSS CUSP program and then subjected to neutrality plot analysis. the RSCU values of the coding sequences were analyzed to gain the characters of synonymous codon usage pattern without the consideration of influence of the composition of amino acids and the size of coding region. the ORFs of the viruses were identified by DNAStar. the basic information of Flaviviridae is listed in Table 1. 85 0.421 0.457 0.4587 -0.226 0.077 0.701 Dengue virus 3 1.13 1.09 2.00 1.38 Zika virus 1.08 1.42 1.22 1.29 1.62 1.07 1.32 1.13 1.00 3.00 1.05 1.23 1.33 1.07 1.04 1.19 1.57 Ration of A/U-ended codons. the analysis was based on the RSCU value of the 59 synonymous codons. the positions of each virus were described in the first two main-dimensional coordinates. the slope of the regression line was calculated to be 0.062. 65 Flaviviridae viruses can be divided into two groups. group I includes Kedougou virus, Louping ill virus, west Nile virus lineage 2 and Yaounde virus. variation range of GC3s content is not extensive (0.364 GC3S 0.582). study of codon usage patterns of viruses can reveal more useful information about overall viral survival, fitness, and evolution. most flaviviridae viruses have a weak codon bias with the mean ENC value of 54.58. in previous studies on Zika virus, it is observed there were greater frequencies of A3S/G3S than U3S. there were some viruses showing contrary characteristics; for example, Aedes flavivirus U3S% was 0.2994 and G3S% was 0.279; Alkhurma virus U3S was % 0.3617 and G3S% was 0.2773. flaviviridae viruses can also be classified into two groups according to their codon usage patterns. their codon usage patterns were influenced by nature selection which dominates 93.8% and mutation pressure which dominates 6.2%.
